faq.question: 1. What is COBKA?
faq.answer: COBKA, also known as Central Oregon Beekeepers Association or Central Oregon Beekeepers, is a volunteer-run organization dedicated to promoting beekeeping in Central Oregon. We provide education, hands-on training, and a supportive community for beekeepers of all levels.

faq.question: 2. How can I become a member of COBKA?
faq.answer: Join COBKA by visiting our membership page: www.cobeekeeping.org/Become-a-member Membership provides access to meetings, resources, equipment loans, and more.

faq.question: 3. Does COBKA offer beekeeping courses?
faq.answer: Yes! We offer an annual Beginner Beekeeping Course, as well as at least one advanced course per year. We also organize hive inspections and field days for hands-on experience.

faq.question: 4. What is the Oregon Master Beekeeper (OMB) Program?
faq.answer: The Oregon Master Beekeeper (OMB) Program is an educational initiative run by Oregon State University (OSU). COBKA offers one free year of membership to OMB participants in Central Oregon and provides a scholarship/reimbursement program to encourage local beekeepers to enroll. Learn more: extension.oregonstate.edu/mb

faq.question: 5. How can I sign up for the OSU Oregon Master Beekeeper Program?
faq.answer: You can register through OSU’s website: extension.oregonstate.edu/mb If you’re in Central Oregon, check out our scholarship and reimbursement program, an initiative to encourage Central Oregon Beekeepers to participate in the OMB program.

faq.question: 6. How do I report a bee swarm?
faq.answer: If you see a honey bee swarm, report it on our Swarm Page: www.cobeekeeping.org/Swarm-Page A local beekeeper may be able to remove and relocate the bees at no cost, as long as they are honey bees.

faq.question: 7. Are there local suppliers for beekeeping equipment in Central Oregon?
faq.answer: Yes! We maintain a list of local beekeeping suppliers to help you find equipment, tools, and bees for your apiary. Visit our Suppliers Page for more information: www.cobeekeeping.org/Suppliers If you know of a supplier we should add, let us know!

faq.question: 8. What should I do before getting bees?
faq.answer: Before purchasing bees, it is important to prepare by gaining knowledge and ensuring compliance with local regulations. Steps to take before getting started: Check local regulations – See FAQ #11 & #12 for rules on hive limits and registration requirements. Take a beekeeping course – Learning proper hive management helps prevent common beginner mistakes. Enroll in the OSU "Getting Started with Bees" Program – A foundational online course designed for new beekeepers. Program details & registration: extension.oregonstate.edu/mb/getting-started-bees Read beekeeping best practices – Learn about responsible hive management. Guide: catalog.extension.oregonstate.edu/em9186 By preparing in advance, you increase the likelihood of successfully maintaining a healthy, thriving colony.

faq.question: 9. Where can I find additional beekeeping resources?
faq.answer: Visit our Beekeeping Links and Resources section for educational materials, regulations, and best practices: www.cobeekeeping.org/Links

faq.question: 10. How can I stay informed about COBKA news and updates?
faq.answer: Join our public email list: http://eepurl.com/cNRj-5 COBKA maintains a limited social media presence; our website and email lists are the best sources for updates and event details. www.cobeekeeping.org

faq.question: 11. How many hives can I keep in Bend, Oregon?
faq.answer: Hive limits depend on lot size. As of early 2025: Under 5,000 sq. ft. → 2 hives max 5,000–10,000 sq. ft. → 4 hives max Over 10,000 sq. ft. → 6 hives max Bend regulations: bend.municipal.codes/BDC/3.6.300

faq.question: 12. Do I need to register my hives with the Sate of Oregon?
faq.answer: If you own five or more colonies, you must register with the Oregon Department of Agriculture. Registration form: https://www.oregon.gov/oda/shared/Documents/Publications/IPPM/ApiaryRegistrationForm.pdf More info: https://www.oregon.gov/oda/programs/IPPM/InsectsSpiders/Pages/BeesApiaries.aspx

faq.question: 13. What are the rules for selling honey in Oregon?
faq.answer: Oregon honey labeling laws: ORS 616.766 Oregon Produce Standards ODA Food Safety

faq.question: 14. How can I get beekeeping help?
faq.answer: COBKA’s “Ask a Master Beekeeper” connects members with an accredited Master Beekeeper for expert guidance. Submit your question here: www.cobeekeeping.org/Ask-a-Master-Beekeeper Choose your response preference: Public Q&A: Get featured on our Ask a Master Beekeeper Response Page Private Reply: Receive an email response Email confirmation provided after submission.

faq.question: 15. How do I check my hives for Varroa mites?
faq.answer: Varroa monitoring methods: Alcohol Wash (most accurate) Sugar Roll (less invasive) Sticky Boards (long-term tracking) Varroa management guide: honeybeehealthcoalition.org/varroatool/

faq.question: 16. What should I do if my hive dies?
faq.answer: Conduct a Hive Necropsy to find out why: Preserve the evidence (leave frames as-is) Collect dead bees (freeze a sample) Log your hive’s history (mites, treatments, feeding, etc.) Why? Helps prevent future losses Rules out possible causes Learn from experience

faq.question: 17. What are emergency feeding options for winter?
faq.answer: Winter feeding methods: Dry Sugar (Sugar Bricks/SockerMat) – Best for freezing temps Fondant – Helps, but watch for moisture issues Pollen Substitute – Only if brood rearing has begun Sugar Syrup – Avoid until daytime highs reach 50°F

faq.question: 18. How can I participate in COBKA events?
faq.answer: COBKA hosts monthly meetings, educational workshops, and community events. Visit our website for the latest meeting schedules, guest speakers, and hands-on field days. Members also receive email updates about upcoming activities.

faq.question: 19. How can I volunteer with COBKA?
faq.answer: COBKA is volunteer-run, and we always need help! Opportunities include: Helping with beginner classes Assisting at community events Coordinating hive inspections Contact us at: contact@cobeekeeping.org Powered by Wild Apricot Membership Software
